label: Description
value: The obliquely shown fountain consists of a basin in the shape of a boat in which a shell with children and sea animals is supported by a dragon and children. The children pour water at each other or the dragon. A hedge with arched openings is supposed to form an enclosure. Framing ink lines. Paper margin.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and white gouache on paper

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Boat-Shaped Vessel, possibly intended as a Festival Float

label: Description
value: A ship-shaped bowl, supported by two mermaids, is surmounted upon a base representing the sea. The bowl is flanked by two high columns with mermaid finials connected to each other by a pole entwined with ribbon. Traces of framing lines are visible at the edges of the sketch.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk on off-white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: P.J. Mariette [1]; Count J.P van Suchtelen [2]; Hippolyte Destailleur [3]; Léon Decloux; 1911: acquired by Museum            [1] Lugt 1852 [2] Lugt 2332 [3] Collection no. 493

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Notes
value: A ship-shaped bowl, supported by two mermaids, is surmounted upon a base representing the sea. The bowl is flanked by two high columns with mermaid finials connected to each other by a pole entwined with ribbon. Traces of framing lines are visible at the edges of the sketch.

label: Description
value: This cofferred dome ceiling has a skylight at the center. Ciruclar medallions frame classical scenes in the widest panels and organic matter border the edges.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor, graphite on laid paper

label: Credit line

label: Description
value: Bacchus and Ariadne on clouds accompanied by three of her companions, three putti, and a panther.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, red crayon, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Fountain in full width of the middle distance is surrounded by trellis and rocaille colonnades. Verso: small parts of an abstract plant and sketch of a pavilion.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash on paper

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for an Escutcheon with Allusions to Egypt

label: Description
value: A fountain is obliquely shown, the back of which is formed by shell containing an ovoid as the field of the escutcheon. It is topped by the head of a lion. Nile is seated, reaching with his right arm over a sphinx toward a jar from which water pours. At the right of him are two children and a dragon. Water is shown in the right foreground. Views of the interior of his temple at right, of three nymphs of sources and a palm at left.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, grey wash, black chalk on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux; acquired by him after 1906. Attributed by him to Jacques de la Joue.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Copy of an escutcheon in one of the fetes publications

label: Description
value: Framed with and formed in the bottom center by attributes of the sea such as the prow and mast of a ship, a dolphin, a swan, a fishing net, a trident.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Different details in the left and right halves. Architectural forms frame an oval. An escutcheon in the bottom center, a cherub in the top center. Angels are suggested crouching in the upper corner; a cherub at right.

value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, graphite on white laid paper

Design for a Bed in the Polish Style

label: Description
value: Canopy bed seen from the end with upholstered footboard with an oval panel at center. Canopy dome is decorated with three clusters of feathers. Hangings are caught at either side with rosettes. At left and at right diagram of construction of bed. Scale below: 4 pied.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash, graphite on laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: At left, frontal view of console table, covered urn draped with a floral garland on stretcher below. Scale plan is seen below table. At right, another suggestion for overleaf and support of table top.

value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash, yellow watercolor, graphite on white laid paper

value: Canopy supported by four posts; upon the corners are bunches of feathers; an urn above and scale below.

label: Description
value: The center panel shows an eagle placed upon a thunderbolt between two acanthus scrolls. The lateral one shows a trophy of arrows, a caduceus, a winged helmut, and a wreath. The main panel shows two putti beside flower vases, pairs of swans beside a woman standing atop a classical frieze.

Design for Sofa, with Alternative Suggestions

label: Description
value: Sofa design in Louis XIV style. Alternative decoration at top rail shows a cornucopia and beading at left, urn and floral design at right. The legs show alternative scroll and leaf design. Sofa is referred to a as a "canapé a joues." Upholstery, dusty pink stripes interspersed with blue floral motif. Scale at bottom: 4 pied.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash, pink and blue watercolor, graphite on heavy white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Center element consists of a quiver filled with arrows supported by four ropes. Four arms, with flowing candles, are decorated with flower clusters and a garland. Flower clusters are entwined around the quiver. Scale at bottom, in black ink: 2 pieds.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash on cream laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle showing two circular mirror frames, or plaques. Left: urn at top, cornucopia with flowers at either side from which are suspended garlands. Right: rollwork terminating in a volute at top, decorated with a flower garland and leaves. Black frame lines.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash, graphite on white laid paper

label: Description
value: At left, oval plaque surrounded by a frame of scrollwork in the shape of a shield with a shell on top, a garland across top of mirror, leafy elements suspended from either side. At right, a plaque in the shape of a shield, scrollwork frame from garlands are suspended, a volute at top. A pinecone is suspended at bottom.

Design for a Mirror Frame, with Alternative Suggestion

label: Description
value: At top center of frame, two winged putti flank a cornered cup, a garland draped across the top of the frame from which a flower basket is suspended. All four sides of the frame are treated differently. At right, a putto seated on a bracket holding a candelabrum. Moldings on right half of frame are undecorated. Left half shows carvings and leaves. Framing black ink lines.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash, light olive watercolor, graphite on white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Two fluted pilasters flank circular dial. Above, a pediment consisting of a covered urn on top, a garland of laurel leaves, and a shell in the recessed section of the pediment. A trophy decorated with leaves and a bow, in lower panel. Partial view of covered urns on either side of base, cushioned feet.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash, graphite on white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Frontal view: A circular frame for dial, surrounded by laurel leaves, mounted on top of a fluted column draped with a garland. Structure sits on base decorated with knobs, cushion feet. Verso: Portrait of a young man, facing left, faintly seen.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash, graphite on white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Above, arabesque motifs of two arms joined by a half figure in the center, and upon which two nude figures sit.  The figure in the center holds up a line with garlands.  Center left, an arabesque terminating in a nude standing warrior with spear and shield.  Center right, a flying nude figure holding a medallion from which is suspended two garlands and a lamp.  Lower left, a corner motif of a ceiling decoration with arabesques, sphinxes and winged genii.  Lower right, a vertical arabesque panel that includes a siren from which is suspended an oval medallion, and above, a standing putto holding two draperies. Ink framing lines.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink with ink wash, graphite on three pieces of paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Top, upper portion of an arabesque panel, consisting of a figure dirving a chariot drawn by four horses on a pedestal rising between two reclining figures. Below, on a panel between sphinxes, a pair of arabesques terminating in half-horse half-human figures. Below, two basiliks standing face to face flanking an urn decorated with a human face.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink with ink wash, graphite on pieces of paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Upper left, a vertical arabesque motif which includes a winged figure terminating in vine tendrills, and above a vase flanked by herms. Lower left, a corner motif of a ceiling cove with two sirens flanking a disc supporting a circular panel, and below, another siren, from which garlands are suspended, and clutching the tails of the sirens above. Right, a vertical panel with a standing draped classical figure between vases, whose headdress is made up of a series of arabesques, a brazier, flanking griffins, and a winged half-figure with a bird on its head.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink with ink wash, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Top left, a mask of a human figure with horns from which are suspended tassels. Under it, a nude female figure seen frontally, seated on a sheet held in both hands, arms extended. Upper right, a motif showing a nude trumpeter standing on a rinceau, and beside him a putto astride a unicorn, and below, another putto carrying a banner. Center left, a winged herm supporting a shelf. Center, a winged terminal figure seen frontally. Lower left, two vases, one in the form of a pitcher whose handle terminates in a human figure who pours liquid into the vase over his shoulder. Lower right, two winged genii flank a medallion showing a putto seated by an urn, and below, two putti embrace over paired volutes flanking a medallion but portrait.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown watercolor, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Rocaille architectural frame (with four figures reclining or standing on it) through which is a fountain (on the left) and a staircase leading to a circular domed space enclosed with arches (on the right).  Reverse: in opposite direction, a circular fantastical structure with men upon loggias; possibly intended as part of a candlestick.

label: Physical description
value: Black chalk, pen and black ink, brush and black wash on laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The motif consists of three Fates shown either seated or standing on shelves supported from a central core, and attended by putti.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink with ink wash, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A standing nude female figure on whose head is a basket supporting two standing lovers. A single swag at the top. The central figure is accompanied by two putti, and below, are five others, three of which float in the sky and carry a garland.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and ink wash, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
